answers.answer: sounds like some of the weight is due to fluid retention, especially since your fingers and feet are so swollen. could be a sign of preeclampsia. i would call your dr.i just did a quick internet search of pregnancy and fluid retention, and this website had some other tricks to help reduce fluid retention.http://parenting.ivillage.com/pregnancy/pfitness/0,,4539,00.htmlgood luck

I would talk to your dr. just to be on the safe side. I know you've had swelling all along but a lot of the pregnancy websites that I Read said that if you have rapid weight gain, it could be a sign of preeclamsia.  You probably dont have it and your fine but, it's better to be safe than sorry.  But they also say that in the third trimester, the weight gain comes FAST!  So that could be it to.  I'm sorry you so swollen.

You may want to watch the amount of sodium your taking in. Salt makes you gain water big time. Try to keep it under 3000mg a day. That may be a reason why you feel so bloated. It will only get worse the farther along you are. I am 26 weeks today and I have gained 24 pounds since the beginning. and my feet, calves and fingers are tight. I'm a pretty thin person otherwise. The morning time I notice I'm more bloated than any other time. I don't know if 6lbs in 14 days is considered alot. I gained 11 lbs in one month so it's pretty much the same as your situation. my doctor is not concerned. If it's something your really worried about and if it's pretty painful you should check with your doctor to see what you can do. Good luck!
PS:29 weeks = not fun!  I'm sick again! and my pelvic area is expanding and it HURTS! I"m walking funny now. :-( Enjoy 28 while your still there!  :)

hi... me again... you got me interested so i kept researching. the more i read, the more it sounds like you should get your blod pressure checked, especially since it's such a dramatic change. i usually don't research the internet because i know it can cause unneccesary concern, but i decided to look this one up since i know of several people who had complications due to preeclampsia. i wouldn't panic or anything... it's probably just normal fluid retention. but for peace of mind, call your dr.http://www.pregnancy-info.net/pregnancy_third_trimester.html

I had that swelling too around the same time...a little later 32 weeks.    Never knew what it was for but I didn't have the weight gain...just severe swelling mostly in my ankles.I'm sorry....I'd talk to the dr as soon as you can.

I'm 22w1d today and I am swelling as well.  I gained 8 pounds in four weeks last time I went to the dr.  It is crazy.  I have gained 2pounds in the last two weeks so I guess that is better.  That puts me at 29pounds and only 22w.  My hands are becoming a big problem, they get numb during the day and I have to take a break from working.  At night they kill me, hurt and stay numb.  It does not seem to get better, I can't even write that long.

Thanks for all the advice.  I am at work and just had my blood pressure checked and it was 112/78-which is great.  I am not sure why I am still having all the swelling.  Do you think I should still call the doctor even though my blood pressure is OK??

Then I bet it's just because we're in our third trimester already and are gaining weight rapidly. I've been trying to slow down because, my dr. said I'm gaining to much and also, She's moving up in my belly so I dont have much room to eat.
If I really did gain another 6 lbs. then I have now gained almost 40 lbs. That is terrible. I don't know what I am doing wrong!! :(

Eat well, get moderate exercise if you feel up to it, and don't stress about your weight.  Some women just gain more.  Don't worry about it.To help with the swelling, lie on your left side and elevate your feet.  Also, make sure you get your bp checked and if you have any other signs of preeclempsia, call your pp right away.Your 3/4 cooked, it won't be long now.I hope you feel better.

Anxious-Thanks for the advice, I like that 3/4 cooked-how cute! :)Newbie-I can only hope you are right about the dramatic weight loss! :)  I can't believe how much I have gained, I have the biggest fear now of being fat forever!! Thanks for the words of encouragement!! :)
Wouldn't that be something- all girls!! :)  Newbie-Did you have the 3d ultrasound done?  Just wondering how it went! :)
Newbe - what is your gain so far and how far are you again?I'm with both of you girls - 22w 29pounds at this rate, I will be close to 45 or so at the end.

I feel your pain :-(Have you been weighing yourself regularly? I just wait for the torture at the dr's office.  Well, they say that our baby's are going through a growth spurt again and I've read they are gaining up to a half a pound a week.  Plus you say you are very swollen and are retaining water, that's most likely were the weight is going.  It's probably not you.  And you know what I've heard is the best part about women who swell during pregnancy, they say that once the baby comes, they have a dramatic weight loss. :-) So I bet you'll loose most of that weight after she comes.

You wont be fat forever but I get scared to.  I bought this book about 2 years ago that helped me loose weight just by telling me all the calories in what I'm eating or want to eat. I lost about 20 lbs just by reading it and disciplining myself.  I will buy it again soon (I gave it to my dad after he had a heart attack) and will stick to it. I didnt even need to excersize. I just changed the way I ate and ate 6 meals a day instead of 3 because it stablized your blood sugar and instead of "crashing" you were at a constant level and so your metablisim sped up. I didnt stop eating what I wanted (like chocolate) but I understood what I was taking into my body and ate smaller portions. It's called, " The CalorieKing Calorie, Fat & Carbohydrate Counter 2007 Edition".  It even tells you the calories in fast food places so you make a better choice (instead of just eating x number of calories, your informed)Try it, it's only 8 bucks :-)

The book is sorta like a do-it yourself weight watcher type thing,  But cheaper :-)The most I've weighted is 230.  It's a long story but, basically, I was a very sick kid with asthma and had lots of steroids pumped into me due to it.  Also, I couldn't excersize due to asthma either.  So I got big!  But I was in my teens when I weighted that much.  My smallest weight was what I weighted before I got prego.  Two years ago, I was also around 150. I got prego then but had a m/c and my weight went up to about 180 (depression). But I lost it with that book I mentioned.So in a way, I look at it as, I've been bigger and was not carrying another person inside me :-) And i know I will drive myself insane if I dont go back to a reasonable weight.  So I dont worry to much about that.  We will all be fine and great and none of this will matter when our 3 girls get here (just a hunch - cantwait :-))
Hi.  I'm 29 weeks and have gained 25 lbs. At my last visit, my dr wasn't to happy with my progress as far as weight gain.

I have had many side effects, the worst is the leg cramps at night right now but so far the third trimester has been the best for me the first two were hell.  I went to the doctor on Monday, I am now 29 weeks, I too have gained too much weight.  I am up to almost 50 lbs now.  Before pregnancy I was average and toned.  Not skinny just average.  I think it is my bodytype it just takes on the lbs and without me being able to exercise or eat/drink diet foods it just is packing on.  I know a few people who started out tiny and gained over 60 and turned out ok in the end.  The doctor said I should watch it but he is not going to yell at me - he said I have been through enough.  :)

I was wondering about you.  I hadn't seen you in a bit.  I'm glad this is your best trimester :-) Cause for me, it really sucks so far.  But I agree with your Dr. you've had it so rough in the beginning that the important thing is that you and your baby are healthy.I'm tryin really hard to be good but, i'm so use to eating whatever I crave that, it's hard to draw the line between healthy consumption and over eating

cantwait- I wish I had your doctor. I am up to about 40 lbs. now and I dread going to the doctor in 2 weeks!!Newbie- I went to Weight Watchers a few years ago and I went from 152 to 126 in about 5 months.  I looked great then! I haven't been that low in a few years. I started out at my heaviest weight ever in the high 150's. :(  Thanks for the info. on the book !:)

Yes I did and it was amazing.  I think I'm going back in  a few weeks because my little princess (stubborn!) didnt want to put her hands and feet down from her face so we didnt get a great shot.  But it was a wonderful experience none the less!  And we saw that she has LOTS of hair!  It's amazing! :-)
Awww! How cute!! Sounds like an amazing experience! :)

Yes, I have been so busy ARGH!....  Baby room and work.Newbie:  I had a m/c about 8 years ago and after I blew up like a baloon.  Gained over 70lbs due to depression and once I got on my feet I had no problem loosing it.  That is why I know I wont have a problem now.  Doctors worry about weight due to complications but it is hard, we are almost done cooking up our tikes try not to worry too much, when he yells just tell him you try but it is hard - Its not like we are sitting home we are all working and tired, who has time to get some exercise in.  I love walking but now after work I clean and cook and I am so tired.  I will guess I will have gained 70lbs by the time I deliver.  - Gnicole - get on MYSPACE so we can support each other in our efforts to loose weight - we will have to check in everyday :)  newbie you too but you are doing much better then us you lucky duck.Once thing is for sure - we wont be depressed after we have our babies and we sure wont have time to eat.  haha

question: I have gained 6 lbs. in 14 days and I am almost 29 weeks.  My feet and ankles are very swollen-more than usual and now my fingers are swollen.  Sometimes my fingers hurt so bad that I cannot bend them.  My questions are is it normal to gain so much weight in such a short amount of time(I know my doctor will freak) and is it normal for my fingers and feet/ankles to be so swollen.  I probably gained more than 6 lbs. because it is still early in the day and my ankles already look like they usually do at the end of the day! Please help!
title: Almost 29 weeks-lots of questions
